data.title: Nova by Samuel R Delany, First Edition
data.meta_description: Nova by Samuel R. Delany and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
New York: Vintage:, 2002. First printing, Trade paperback, Fine, 241 pp. A sturdy and attractive new edition of what a reviewer for THE SCIENCE FICTION TIMES calls "One of the most complete and fully realized pictures of an interstellar society that I have ever read." First printing, Trade paperback, Fine,

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Good. First Thus. New York: Bantam Books [1969]. Good. 1969. First Thus. Mass Market Paperback. First edition thus. 1969 Hugo Award nominee. "An interstellar odyssey---and one of the most brilliant mind adventures of our time!" Pictorial wrappers, 215 pages. Good copy [spine creased and cocked, cover creasing, waterstaining to the page edges at the fore-edge corners, cheap text paper tanned] with a sticker affixed to the rear cover. .

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Near Fine. First Paperback Edition. Bantam Books # H4738; 12mo 7" - 7½" tall; 215 pages; [SIGNED] 1969 Bantam Books # H4738. 1st paperback edition. Mass market sized paperback in glossy color pictorial covers. Tightly bound and fresh with crisp edged corners and flat uncreased spine. Inscribed and signed by Delany on the title page, dated 1992 at Rye where Delany was the guest of honor at the 1992 Lunacon fest. Publisher's yellow edge stain bold and uniform. Appears unread. NF; Signed by Author.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. 1st Paperback Edition 1st Printing. Bantam, 1969. 1st Paperback Edition 1st Printing. Soft cover. Very Good/No Jacket as issued. 8vo - over 7Â¾ - 9Â¾" tall. This is Bantam H-4738 ($0.60). The book has light wear to the extremities. Signed and dated "November '99" by the author on the title page.

Hardcover. Condition: very good. Dust Jacket Condition: very good. First edition. One of the major forerunners of the cyberpunk genre due to the depiction of human interfacing with computers via implants. Neil Gaiman is reportedly working on a television adaptation of Nova for Prime Video. Creasing with small chips to the edges of the dust-jacket. Not price-clipped ($4.95). Very clean pages. First edition. 6" - 8½". book.

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Good. First Thus 7th Printing. Repaired; Light Creasing on Front, Rear Covers; Front, Rear Covers, Spine Lightly Chipped; Edges Lightly Soiled. By the author of Dhalgren. SYNOPSIS: A passion for vengeance drove Captain Lorq Von Ray to dare what no mortal had ever done - to sail through the splintering core of a disintegrating sun. Von Ray's obsession drew aimless souls into the vortex of his madness - wandering adventurers who would plug into any ship that promised escape: MOUSE: A young gypsy, he created blindingly beautiful visions on the syrynx, an instrument of sensor projection. IDAS and LYNCEOS: Twins from the outer colonies, one black, one albino. SEBASTIAN: A golden-haired man who traveled the stars with his Tarot-reading mate and six black-taloned beasts. KATIN: The scholar who loved the silent moons of the universe above all the powerful suns and gaudy planets. Size: 12mo - over 6¾" - 7¾" tall.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. Russell Fitzgerald, dj art. (illustrator). Book Club Edition 1st Printing. Doubleday, 1968. Book Club Edition 1st Printing. Hardcover. Very Good/Very Good. 8vo - over 7Â¾ - 9Â¾" tall. Russell Fitzgerald, dj art. This book is a Book Club Edition of a book that was published as a First Edition Hardcover. The book has slight soling to the edges of the page block. The dust jacket has slight wear to the extremities, light browning to the rear panel, and is unclipped, but also unpriced. Signed by the author on the title page.

Oversize hardcover. First edition thus (& 1st printing). SF novel, first published in 1968. This oversize hardcover adds a 14-page introduction by Lavelle Porter, a 12-page afterword from the author, a 12-page afterword about Samuel Delany by Pat Califia, artwork by Piotr Jablonski, and Tarot Cards by Russell Fitzgerald, all in all a very attractive volume. LIMITED EDITION: 300 numbered copies signed by the author, Jablonski and Porter, and slipcased. This is no 121. Fine copy in a fine dustjacket and slipcase (as new).

First edition. Signed, first edition of this novel from Samuel Delany, published at the age of 25, and nominated for the Hugo award the following year. The work was an important influence on the Cyberpunk genre of the coming decades, and combined themes of race, politics, and culture into a mythological space opera that was well ahead of its time. 8vo, 279pp. Signed and inscribed by Delany to the former owner in Seattle, 1981, on the title page. Pink cloth backed black cloth boards in jacket. Some bumping at spine ends, few smudges to boards, page block edge lightly foxed. Jacket with rubbing to edges and along folds, some toning to rear panel. Original price of $4.95 intact. A very good copy.
